intro: Herrea brevisepala, commonly known as the short-winged heath, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or on rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
